context: Karistus is an Estonian noun meaning punishment or penalty. It refers to measures applied as a result of wrongdoing, offenses, or bad behavior - whether disciplinary, judicial, or educational in nature. The word can describe various types of punishments ranging from mild penalties to severe sentences, and is commonly used in legal contexts when discussing court-imposed sanctions.
